body.p: “How snug and warm a hemlock looks in the winter! That by the azalea looks thus: [image] There is a tendency in the limbs to arrange themselves ray-wise about a point one third from the base to the top. What singular regularity in the outline of a tree!”
PE 10, pg. 49 / 13 May 1855-3 January 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:25 / T vol. # XIX / PDF # XIV / JVII & JVIII
